intro: Tephrosia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, blooming during the wet season. Its root system is fibrous, and it is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Tephrosia stricta is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
